item.title: Join the Rensselaer Consulting Club This Summer
item.description: Looking to gain real-world consulting experience this summer? Join the Rensselaer Consulting Club (RCC). Open to all undergrads, RCC offers hands-on projects in AI for small businesses and immigrant-led entrepreneurship. Build your resume, work with real clients, and make a local impact. No prior consulting experience needed. Just curiosity, commitment., flexible and collaborative. Interested? Contact Dr. Kevin Fletcher at fletck3@rpi.edu.

item.title: Volunteer with Sidewalk Warriors | July 3
item.description: Take time to give back during your summer break! Join the CCPD and engage with the local community as we volunteer with Sidewalk Warriors on Thursday, July 3rd from 4:30-8pm. Register and learn more in Handshake and reach out to Dean Burke, burked5@rpi.edu, with questions.

item.title: STEM Outreach Survey For Parents
item.description: Date: Tuesday, June 10, 2025 12:00 AM - Mon , June 16, 2025 12:00 AM - Are you a parent of a K-12 student? The RPI Engineering Outreach Program is looking to better understand how families engage with STEM and how we can improve access and support. This short, anonymous, survey (about 5 minutes) will help. Your input is greatly appreciated! If you have multiple children, please enter one form per child. Thank you!

item.title: 2025 RAA Annual Meeting (Virtual) | June 17
item.description: Date: 6/17/2025 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM The Rensselaer Alumni Association (RAA) will hold its annual meeting and election on Tuesday, June 17 at 7 p.m. Eastern Time. Once again, the annual meeting will be held in a virtual format. During the meeting, the RAA will share a recap of the last year, discuss plans for the upcoming year, and review the 2025 Board member slate and bylaw amendments.
item.author: Community

item.title: 2025 National Organic Chemistry Symposium (NOS) June 22-26
item.description: The 49th NOS will be held June 22–26, at RPI! Sponsored by the ACS Division of Organic Chemistry, this 100th-anniversary event is expected to welcome over 450 participants from across the United States & around the world. It will feature top speakers highlighting advances in synthesis, biocatalysis, polymers, and drug discovery. Nobel Laureate Dr. Morton Medhal will give the keynote. The program also includes poster sessions and career panels. More info: https://www.nationalorganicsymposium.org/

item.title: Standing on the Shoulders of Heroes Pride Exhibit | June 16-July 13
item.description: Date: Monday, June 16, 2025 - Sun , July 13, 2025 (all day) - In celebration of Pride Month, the LGBTQ+ Task Force presents an exhibit celebrating heroes who have stood tall in the face of injustice. Please visit these posters on the main floor of Folsom Library. Each one shares the story of people who have risked much to speak for others. Exhibit courtesy of Stonewall National Museum and Archives and thanks to the generosity of Jason Hagopian ’91, ’92, the Rensselaer Alumni Association and the…

item.title: No Pressure, Just Pride: LGBTQ+ Mixer | June 18
item.description: Celebrate Pride Month with the CCPD! On Wednesday, June 18th from 5-7pm, students, faculty, and staff who identify as LGBTQ+ or allies are invited to a low-stakes mixer in Sage Banquet Hall. Participants will get to know each other in a relaxed environment and learn about resources on- and off-campus. Hors d’oeuvres and refreshments will be served and the CCPD’s Clothing Closet will be available. Come as you are and join us for a night of community and joy!

item.description: Date: Tuesday, June 17, 2025 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with a real-world MBA experience. item.title: The Division of Human Resources is relocating!
item.description:
The Division of Human Resources is relocating from the Gurley Building (21 Union Street, 2nd Floor) to our new home in the Chasan Building (405 Broadway, 1st Floor) on June 16, 2025. While our physical location is changing, all phone numbers and email addresses will remain the same.
